intro: Pseuduvaria nova-guineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea pseuduvaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of New Guinea and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded forest environments. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
